headline: Ham Salad Spread
description: This ham salad spread with hard-cooked eggs, mayonnaise, mustard, and pickle relish is quick and easy to whip up for a party or holiday gathering!

video.description: Looking for a dip for your next party?
video.name: Ham Salad Spread

name: Ham Salad Spread

recipeInstructions.text: Mix ham, eggs, celery, pickle relish, and onion together in a medium bowl until combined.
Mix mayonnaise and mustard together in a small bowl; pour over ham mixture and stir to coat.

review.reviewBody: I made it, as written, using canned flakes of ham. It was delicious!

I love this recipe; only change I made was to put dill pickle relish in half the recipe and sweet relish in the other half. We loved it both ways! My mom made this often when we were kids and we love it in sandwiches.
Loved this. I used Miracle Whip instead of Mayo for added tang.
Very easy and didn't last long!
I am picky about ham salad but I dearly love this one. The only thing is we added a little more egg but it was nothing major. Thank you for posting this for me to use. My wife is happy with it also.
Excellent the way it was written, no changes necessary!
Love this recipe. Make it all the time. I omit the egg. Just doesn't work in there for me.
Very good recipe. Increased celery but that was it. Would make it again.
The hard boiled eggs are a great touch (My Mom never used them). I like how you tailor it to your own taste, although, other than a little more onion, I think it is great.

Love this recipe and always make it when I have left over ham along with navy bean soup also on here. The ham is best when chopped with a food processor or grinder. Cutting by hand isn't the same. The only thing I've done different is I use two different kinds of mustard, yellow and a spicy one and maybe add a little more relish. It depends on the flavor of the ham. Like another reviewer said you can adjust all ingredients to your liking. 

Great recipe...thank you for sharing.

This was delicious, quick and easy made in my food processor. I don’t like hard-boiled eggs somI left them out, but otherwise followed the recipe exactly. Moist and full of flavor. I intend to keep a tub of this in the refrigerator for sandwiches and snacking.
We liked it alot. I added more egg just because we love boiled eggs. But it was really good.

Best ham salad recipe! I never thought to add HB eggs. Even my twin 7 month old grand babies liked it. Only sub I did was dill pickles instead of sweet pickle relish. (I don’t like sweet). Thanks, it’s a keeper!!

We have been searching for a good ham salad spread for years and this is IT!!! My husband loves the spread from Lunds/Byerlys but we don't have one anywhere close to us anymore. We've tried a variety of other grocery store versions with no luck, amazing how many bad ones are out there. I saw this recipe and it looked just like one my mom used to make so I thought I'd try it. Definitely the best! The only thing I did a little different is I used diced/minced green onion vs. white or yellow etc. and I minced the celery as well - still crunchy but no huge chunks. I also chose Kraft Real mayo vs. any others. Bon appetit!

When I first put it all together I thought ho hum another boring ham spread. But wow was I wonderfully surprised the next morning when I gave it a taste. The flavors just needed to blend. I finally found a recipe my whole family likes. It is a keeper. I made sandwiches and stuffed some cucumbers from the garden Yum! Thank you for sharing this recipe. I also chopped some bread and butter pickles and put them on my sandwich along with a little spread of mayo on the bread slices!
My husband loved it so much that I had to make a double batch the second time only two days later! Great for sandwiches, on crackers or even by the spoonful for a quick snack.
12/27/20 - made per recipe minus fresh onion and celery (we don't like the crunch) and egg (didn't have time). Hubby thought this was much closer to his mom's recipe (which we don't have.
I have made it with and without the eggs
My mom used to make this but used check bologna, it was so good. She would put the bologna through a meet grander and then mix in all the ingredients, we loved it.
Perfect recipe. Added Jalapeño relIsh to taste.
Loved it. I hate to buy an entire onion for such a small amount in the recipe. I substituted onion and used a small shallot.

I ground up everything in my Ninja. So it was so smooth and very tasty. It made enough for me to share with my neighbors. I used the left over Easter ham. That was a good use for it. Thanks for this good recipe
Very good! I only made a third recipe just in case...made as written except used dill relish since that's what I had on hand.

I can't decide if its a 4 or 5 star. The family really liked it. I finally got to use my meat grinder on the smaller grind. I added more celery, onion and relish than it said. I like the sweetness of the relish. We made sandwiches with lettuce and cheese. Our boys loved it so we were happy. We doubled the recipe so we are happy to have leftovers during this quarantine.
So easy and very delicious. I buy rolls at the bakery and make ham spread sandwiches for a quick lunch. Great with crackers!!! Thank you !!
I love this recipe. Very simple to follow. It was the best ham salad I ever had. I will definitely make this again and again.

This was a delicious ham spread, exactly what I was looking for. !I needed to make an appetizer for a get together and I wanted to use up leftover ham. I served it with a sliced baguette and also crackers I used my food processor to grind the ham to the consistency that I wanted. very easy to put together and loved by everyone that ate it!
I made a half batch of this but otherwise didn’t change it, my family really liked this with crackers or on bread.

The measurements are right on and the results are excellent.

I did not add the hard boiled eggs so I give my version a 4
Wonderful, love it. Will use again and again
Love it! I made three pickle varieties; sweet, spicy, dill. I like the dill best.
made no changes, but like mine a little sweeter, might add more relish next time
I made this exactly as written and it came out excellent. I will definitely make it again!
Made many times as written. Perfect. All I change is the consistency- chunkier for sandwiches, smoother for appetizer w/ baguette or crackers.
I only had 2 cups of ham so I just used less of the mayo and mustard and mixed to taste. We thought is was yummy.

I love this recipe because it has all the ingredients to make a great ham salad spread. I like sweet relish over dill for this. I prefer yellow over Dijon, too. That’s what makes this recipe great. Use your preferences. I did not use nearly a whole cup of mayo because it overtakes the ham flavor. This has been my go to recipe for years.
I've made ham salad many times with no real recipe. Blended up some leftover ham and mixed with mayo. Followed this recipe without edits and it turned out great. I will use this from now on. thanks
delicious and east tomake.

Only gave this four stars because I didn't follow the recipe completely. I omitted the eggs because I don't believe I've ever had ham salad with eggs but it turned out really good anyway. it was a really good way of getting rid of that leftover ham from Christmas dinner.
Excellent recipe! Tastes exactly like my mom made when I was a kid. Will make again and again. Thanks for sharing!
Mixed in 1 tsp nature seasoning before adding mayonnaise and mustard.
left out the eggs

3 cups ham = 1 Lb.
Great recipe. I started with 3/4 C of mayo, knowing that I could always add more and that was plenty of mayo.
Very good and easy

I followed the recipe although I didn’t measure as I’m not baking. With apprehension, the mustard was added. I of course had to try it before refrigeration and must say the mustard is a pleasant surprise! This is the best ever. Thanks so much for sharing!
This ham salad sung me back home it was very good and I'll be making it again.
No changes and this is my all time favorite ham salad recipe.

I made as directed, except I didn't have celery. It would be better with it, I just couldn't get to the store. Funny how someone said they didn't like the eggs in it. My son thought the whole thing tasted like egg salad with ham, so I had an extra egg and threw it in for good measure. More protein. Haha. Our AC is down and it is too hot to cook, so we made a batch of homemade bread in the breadmaker to go with this and it made a great meal without heating up the house even more.

I made this salad with leftover ham; My husband loved it. I followed recipe, however, I didn't have pickle relish but I had my homemade zucchini relish. Great with crackers and as a sandwich spread. Fantastic. Very easy to make too!
Easy, on-hand ingredients and delicious! Couldn’t be any better. Rave reviews from all. Thanks for posting.
Growing up, it was a given that anytime we baked a ham for the Holidays, ham salad would follow. This is a good spread and is equally good on a sandwich.
I doubled the eggs and ham, celery and onion but stuck to the 1 cup of mayonnaise. I used “Wickles Wicked Relish. It was a hit at the potluck.
Top notch just like at the deli!
My new go to recipe for ham salad!

Outstanding. I was a little confused by the discrepancy (4tsp. vs. 4 tbs) of pickle relish, so I fudged by putting an amount somewhere in between the two. Also used about half the amount of mayonnaise, but otherwise followed the recipe to the letter. Everyone who tried it LOVED it. We always have leftover ham, so will be freezing some big chunks of it to make ham salad for weeks to come!
I made it just as the recipe says ( I always do the first time I make something) and it was very good. Took it to work and everyone enjoyed it.
EXCELLENT - I made it exactly as listed and it was perfect. So Simple too!!
This recipe intrigued me since it was variation of my mom’s ham salad. Excellent combination of ingredients! This one is a keeper. Don’t change anything!
50 years? Awesome! Wait, I’m 52...my Mom’s horrible cooking is 50+...Well I’m still gonna try it!

I didn't think it had enough flavor so I added 1/2 tsp of salt and pepper. Still wasn't sweet enough for me so I added 2 tsp of sugar. Come to find out the recipe is written with 4 tsp of relish and the video said 4 tablespoons of relish. Makes a big difference; I may not have needed to add extra of anything. I'l find out next time.

Just finished making this and I cut the mayo to 3/4 cup and it still was too soupy. Fortunately, I had leftover cornbread so ground that up and tossed it in to absorb the extra mayo. Other than that issue the flavors are very good. Like others stated, just like Mom used to make.
I didnt have any relish so I chopped some dill pickles and added some jalapeno jelly. Nice tang.
Easy to prepare, before asic ingredients and YUM!
It was so good and this may small change
this was wonderful with left over honey-baked ham. I followed the instructions as is. No need to change anything. Will make it again

I’ve made this recipe 3 times now. I think it’s perfect with sweet pickle relish. Add more or less of the various ingredients to meet your tastes, but don’t use dill pickles then rate this recipe. It will completely change the taste.

Made it, exactly, well, almost exactly, Yummm, but have to say I did use Honey Baked Ham, which is yummm on its own. I’m not a big ham fan but thank you, thank you, thank you for sharing this family goodie. Don’t hesitate to make it, it will be a hit, oh, and I used my rough meat grinder on my Kitchen Aide mixer, perfect and took about 20 min start to licking the spoon.
Replace the “two tbsp finely chopped celery” with “two tbsp finely chopped radish” and you have a winner. ??
Only change I made was to leave out boiled egg (not a fan). Family loved it!

This is really good! I used leftover ham from Christmas and adjusted the ingredients for 2 cups of ham. I don't have a meat grinder, so I just tore the ham into small chunks. Next time, I may add a little more celery because I like the crunch it gives. Excellent as a sandwich or with crackers.

Good recipe. Comment: I have a problem with people leaving a negative review if you totally change everything about a recipe. If your recipe is the best ever, I don’t think other cooks’ recipes should be slammed. This is a good recipe.

11-26-18 Great tasting ham salad recipe. I made this with leftover ham from Thanksgiving and ran the ham through the food processor until just the right consistency. Used Dijon mustard instead of yellow to add a little more punch to the flavor. Next time I want to try it with dill relish as others have suggested. My guests I had for lunch remarked about how good it was! A recipe that rakes in the compliments is never a bad thing!!

This was great! I made a few adjustments, though. Instead of ham I used store bought nacho chips, and instead of eggs I used cake frosting. I don't fancy mayonnaise, so I swapped that out for chicken stock, and then I completely avoided using anything else listed in this recipe.

Seriously, what is with people changing the recipe drastically and then leaving negative reviews? Don't you realize that as soon as you change the recipe, you're not reviewing the same thing? Sheesh people...
Good recipe. I mixed mine a little too much but flavor was great.

I made it right by the recipe and it was pretty good. I am not that big a fan of baked ham, but this was a great way to use up some left overs. The only thing I did different was use one half cup mayo and one half cup salad dressing.
Really really good
Really good! The whole family loved it.
I purchased 2 lbs. of ground ham in the supermarket & adjusted the recipe. We ate it on bread as a sandwich & also on crackers. It was good both ways. My husband really enjoyed it!
I really liked it as is, the next time I used some chicken breast I had cooked, and then chopped into small pieces only because I had some friends over who can't eat ham.
Excellent. Omitted the eggs. would make this again!

So this is one of the first recipes I’ve ever made as directed with most of the ingredients in the recipe except I doubled it due to the amount of ham I had on hand except I used half greed yogurt and half mayo, only change. This is an incredible recipe! I kept thinking I wanted to add garlic but it did NOT need it. This recipe is truly perfect as is. I used food processor and pulsed every ingredient separately. It helped to create the perfect consistency. Please try this. You will not be disappointed!!!
Very good as is. Will be making this often. Thank you!

Yum! I used leftover ham from Easter dinner and omitted the eggs because I had egg overload at Easter! I used dill relish because that’s all I had and also threw in some deviled egg filling that was left over. It was so good we’re eating on crackers tonight for a light super but this will be so good on a sandwich with lettuce too. Thank you for the recipe!
Delicious!!!!
Really about perfect. Doubled the sweet pickle relish. Recommended.

A trip down memory lane. Mom used to make this with leftover Easter ham and ground the ham up with one of those hand-cranked meat grinders that clamped onto the edge of the kitchen table. I used this as a stuffing for appetizers. Stuffed it into English cucumber disks (about 1 inch thick, hollowed out a bit to make room for the ham salad), celery, and sugar snap peas. Took this to a party and they all disappeared.
Will make again

Love this simple recipe! I used more eggs because I had more ham than the recipe called for, I used my small food chopper to ground the ham to the consistency I wanted, but only the ham. I just used a fork to mash the egg whites, I took a page from a another reviewer and mixed the egg yolks in the mayo mixture. I used mayo that had olive oil and cracked black pepper, mustard, and a bit of cayenne pepper for a little kick. I used onion powder instead of onions, no celery because I didn't have any. This turned out wonderful! I didn't measure anything, just used what looked right, the salad is firm and not runny at all, and the it taste delicious, I have been eating it on toasted hoagie rolls.
Was the perfect way to use up left over Christmas ham. I buy a lot of ham salad from the store. This is far better than anything you will find at the grocery.
I didn't make any changes and my mother -in-law raved about it. She told me that this might be an after Christmas tradition.
We love this, but we make it without the egg! Great as a sandwich, or a snack on crackers! Sweet relish makes the big difference.

Loved it just put ham in a blender or food processor works out perfect I used a 1/2 cup each of mayonnaise and miracle whip instead of a whole cup makes it creamer and also added a little cheese block of Colby Jack and cheddar cut up real small hope you like it like I do.

This is my first ever review because this is the first recipe I have found on all recipes that I did not significantly change. I have to say, I was sceptical but with a massive amount of ham that needed to be used I went with it. this is really, really good. I did not measure anything but the ham (I ended up with 4 cups after processing) I used 4 eggs, 2 dill pickle spears and honey mustard because of course that's all I had. Next time, I will use more pickle, yum! and maybe add a little cream cheese because I love ham rolls and that is what this tastes like. I made this for sandwiches and it's delicious! 
note- I did the whole salad in my processor, next time I will only process the ham because the texture is a little funny for me, but still, so delicious!
Thought it was great. Added a little more mayonnaise, pickle relish and a couple spoons of sugar since my smoked ham was a little dry.
I followed the recipe to a T and LOVED it! I could have ate the whole batch myself! Thank you for sharing. Will definitely make this again.
Absolutely love this! So refreshing for summer sandwiches...

I loved this so much I inhaled it! I didn't have onions, so I threw in some extra celery for texture and onion powder for flavor. I also used honey mustard, but I'm not sure if that made a difference. I used my food processor instead of "mixing" like it says. Clean up is fairly ready too. If you like ham salad sandwich spreads, consider making this instead if buying it at the store. It's easy and very very yummy! And you get more bang for your buck making it at home.
Needing additional spices for flavor...simple tasting!
